The presentation of multiple CNS lesions disseminated in space is classic for inflammatory demyelinating diseases. Multiple Sclerosis is the most common cause in this demographic. However, the specific finding of 'perihilar ground-glass changes' on CXR strongly suggests pulmonary involvement, raising the index of suspicion for Neurosarcoidosis. NMOSD and MOGAD are important mimics to exclude.
